reviews.review_msg: Love this man. He really is passionate about his field and his energy about material that can be overwhelming helps ease students in to understand the material. Yes it is a hard class at times, but go to tutorial and put some effort in and it is really is an easy A. I recommend any class he teaches!

FANTASTIC! He is such a sweet man and a good lecturer. He really cares about his students and he is thoughtful about what he teaches. The class topics were interesting and overall not that difficult as long as you study and do the work. Some people complained about the 1st midterm but it was very fair, they just didnt study. I did well & loved it!

Ian was a great prof for this class, however I noticed the BA HSci students struggled with this class. Super friendly, answered all emails and questions on time, not a hard marker either. Make sure you do the readings and more importantly go to class. I hope to take a class with him again!

The difficulty of the course initially made me worry about my grade but after time I learned to realize that there is no real victory if there is no real challenge. In retrospect Dr. Tietjen seems to have taught me more than I paid for and for that I am grateful. He has forever made a profound impact on my life. I only wish he taught more classes.

At the end of the day, Ian does what University is for - teach you about what matters. Is he a super easy prof? Nope. Did I learn a lot in his class? More than I've ever learned in any course. This is coming from someone who JUST wrote the final so there's no grade bias, but he genuinely cares and hes BRILLIANT. Would recommend if you want to learn

Easy guys. It was is first sem and he comes from Harvard, class avg was low after 1st exam bc of random questions, didn't know what to focus. But 2nd exam was EASY, class avg went up 10%, he has good potential for future classes, I would say do it! its a content heavy class so ofc it isn't easy but project deffs boosts ur grade and curve helps!

First semester lecturing, reflected in the low midterm averages and dissatisfaction among many students as he tries to find what works and what doesn't. Was not very clear about expectations from Disease Busters project. Midterms were easy if you studied his notes thoroughly, textbook was useless. Would recommend once he has taught a bit more.

He is a new teacher and this is his first semester of teaching class. I would really recommend him to teach 900-level courses. Most midterm content did not reflect the study guide he provided did not reflect what we need to know. The course did not require any text book but get ready to answer questions that you have never learned.

Augustine is a nice guy and loves health sciences. You can pretty much ask any question. Isn't too demanding, just the usual. Doesn't mind if you say the wrong answers. Also, he looks like ngolo kante. Dope guy

Dr.N was a good prof. Lectures were content heavy but not hard to follow along. Had bi-weekly quizzes which were straightforward. Grading was harsh, so beware of going over the word count for assignments. Lectures were sometimes uploaded late, the prof also responds to emails late or never. TA was very accessible. Overall, it was an easy class.

Pros: Lectures are recorded, very good review rubric, knowledgeable; Cons: Lectures are sometimes dry, outside readings required but not unreasonable, grading from TA inconsistent, grading rubric is harsh(since every level is 1/4 of the marks in that section, so if it's not perfect, bye-bye 25%!!!!), grading is on the slow side as well.

This is not an easy class, but she makes it so engaging, and really cares about students learning that it makes it so worth it. Lectures are engaging, and she is kind and understanding. would take a class just because she is teaching it!

I didn't enjoy the class as much as I expected. She is probably the most boring prof I've ever had but she's a nice person. We were allowed to use a cheat card which was VERY useful. My biggest issue with this class is that the group project was not clear and grades for it came out after the semester was over so I couldn't even go dispute the grade

She expected you to know a lot of terms which even not covered by her lecture. Her slide looks good and easy but the test is way beyond that and the cheat card is not enough to help to survive. Grading is so slow and even she noticed the criteria is not clear enough lol

She literally drop a lot weight grades by the end of the last day of whole term and then sent a scale say this is how she do the grades. Now, we cant email her, contact TA about project and got a really bad grades. Lecture was so intense like a MBB class. Definitely avoid this class and her!!!!!!!!

Dr. van Houten needs to reconside her career in teaching. Class materials are so disorganized and inaccessible to students, and she marks inconsistently and didnt release our marks for projects or exams until it was too late to discuss them with her. She didnt give us our main project marks until weeks after the semester ended. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

Dr. Houten is an ok prof, she's knowledgeable on the topic but she takes the class way too seriously. This was a 2nd year HSCI course but it's more like an MBB class. There is a group project worth 25% but her instructions for it were very vague and disorganized. She did let us bring in cue cards for exams but it didn't help. Overall very mediocre.

Honestly, her slides are really useless and tets a lot of things outside her lecture slides that she expects you to read on like articles and videos. Its a little bit heavy on the bio side, but I like that. What I don't like is how it doesn't really explain it, and just throws a bunch of terms. Don't take this course with her.

She tries hard to make the exams fair and acknowledges that some people don't excel in science-heavy topics. Basic knowledge of the processes and definitions are all that's basically asked for since she wants everyone to do well. Due to this, exams are very fair. If you make an honest effort while studying there's no way you can get less than a Bga

This is required for the BA program however, she has it very science based. Talks fast and the class gets lost because a lot of the class are in the BA stream. Very detailed material. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU ARE NOT GOOD AT BIOLOGY. She has every biology based no social science.

Her tests are very hard and the marking was also hard. There is a fairly simple group project, although she changed the marking scheme so people ended up doing worse than their original mark. I found the content was interesting, but definitely focussed towards science students. I wouldn't recommend this course to someone in arts.
Never take this class for you hsci major!!!!!!!! Exams are soooo hard. We are in hsci not in Mbb Prof is good and lectures are pretty ok. But the test material is so hard. skip this one  hsci212

Was really looking forward to this course but she ruined it. Notes made no sense and her drawings had no relation to topic and were confusing. Got a good mark in the group pres but months later she decreased the mark because it didn't match up with previous semester averages.
Her notes are not good and tests are very difficult.

She's a really nice person, and a good lecturer. She'll bring in some guest lecturers too - this content is testable. Class averages on the midterms were very low, so be aware of tough tests. The TAs are the ones that do the marking so try and get an easy marker.

I loved Nienke! I thought she was very clear in her lectures and was very passionate about what she taught. Her brining in guest lecturers was also really awesome - I really enjoyed that! Do be careful, that there is a group project worth quite a lot that  I found somewhat pointless. Also, her tests can be a little unclear!

Extremely disorganized and will tell you she's posting lecture slides but they will be completely out of order and more effort to look through than to just type while she's talking. She goes extremely fast and loses half the class. Not worth it. Would never take a class with her again. I was super interested in taking this class and now I regret It

Very clear prof. Lectures are recorded so you don't really need to be there, though it helps to see what she's drawing on the board. Just study the learning objectives and you'll do well, her exams are not tricky at all

Stating that her quizzes are "tricky" is an understatement. They're not even quizzes..more like midterms. Textbook was completely useless, basically lost one hundred dollars. The only decent thing about this class was her interest in the course material..oh wait never mind she barely lectured, always had a guest lecturers.
I found this class to be very interesting. The text book was useless. But as long as you listened to the lectures, should be fine :)
Her lectures are very informative, and she's very approachable in person. Her multiple choice questions on (quizzes/midterm(s)) are tricky though.
If you want an awesome grade, study hard. No point of complaining here, it's a 2nd yr hsci course! Overall good prof and if you follow and do what she says you'll do well.

Holy this woman cannot teach for the life of her. mostly because she gets confusing guest lecturers to come in and teach for her. and the few lectures she does teach she goes way too fast and loses the entire class. does biweekly quizzes that have such low averages when returned that students feel discouraged and cant even go to her for help. avoid
Awesome prof. Very interesting, quirky and engaging. HSCI 212 has by far been my favourite course at SFU. Make good notes, and cue cards.

This class had a lot of guest lecturers which made it hard to study. Dr. N. made that easier by giving us weekly a study questions guide, and the TAs went over stuff in tutorial. Overall a very interesting but challenging class. I really liked that Dr. N.  changed the tutorials and study guide based on our suggestions. Very easy to talk to!

readings need to be done ONLY for participation marks, supplement readings not examable. Exam includes ONLY lecture slides from MANY guest lecturers, making it hard to take down the learning objectives. Exam is very detailed, asks a lot from learning objectives. 50% exam avg. scaled class. wasted $70 on textbook, never have to use. AVOID

Can't teach at all. She doesn't know the material well. Inviting  guest speakers all the time but exams seem to be unrelated to the materials coming from those guest speakers. she has absolutely no clue on what she is doing in class

Tbh she's not that bad. I wish the instructions for the group project could be clearer tho. It was confusing. We finished the final exam 3 days ago (April 11) and it was difficult. Idk why someone said they got an A+ before the exam lol. According to the syllabus, the MT worths 25% and the final worths 35%.It's test heavy so yeah ik it's stressful.

The exams were not 60% whoever mentioned that. Dr.King is a great professor because she's so passionate in her field that it's contagious! (Infectious disease pun). midterms, exams, and assignments were all fair and she provides study guides which basically have everything u need to study. She's a very caring professor and 100% recommend her.
Francis is the rudest TA ever. Avoid him at all costs.

Dr. King is a great professor. She posts weekly study guides with questions on that week's lecture materials, as well as articles that dive deeper into the topics. The study guides are extremely crucial to complete. Don't skip them. They aren't for marks but they can be the difference between a pass and a fail.
She never posted the answers of the study guide. Very awkward
Get ready to memorize a lot…Lecture slides are extremely long and the exams worth 60% of the final grade. Very stressful

When you google little old Ralph, the first picture that shows up is him with a huge (but off putting) grin on his face. DON'T LET THAT silly smirk fool you. He is a power hungry, insecure man with zero respect for anyone. I feel like he acts like this because he has never been loved (very sad), but he does not need to take it out on his students.
Was very disrespectful and had no sympathy for students learning. would not take again

He is not very approachable whatsoever, don't bother emailing him as he is rude and makes uncalled accusations. I had to put in a lot of effort in this class to get a good mark but learned through my TA more than the prof himself. Overall, not a nice person and doesn't really care about his students.

The course content was VERY broad. Ralph delivers lectures quite poorly, says "um" a lot and often goes off topic. Way too many guest lectures. Overall a very poorly structured and delivered course. Was interested in Infectious/Immunological diseases but not so much anymore after this course.

This prof sucks. He teach nothing during the course. Half of the course is guest lectures and it is really hard to understand the concept behind. He did not clarify how the assignment would be graded and what should be included in the assignment. Don't expect to learn anything in this class with him unless you like reading boring lecture slides.

There's no doubt Ralph is a great researcher and probably writes great papers, but as a lecturer he's not that great. He will explain concepts if you ask after class, but in general lectures are disorganized and hard to follow at times, esp the guest lectures. Very unclear about what will be on the final, assignments also challenging. nice, but no.

Avoid taking HSCI212 with Ralph at all costs. This class is incredibly unorganized, lecture content is confusing, and half the lectures are guests. Ralph claims its his "class policy" to not give out practice questions for the final, I've never been so confused about what could possibly be on the final. Rude to students asking fair questions.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. HE WILL TELL YOU ALL YOUR ASSIGNMENTS ARE PLAGIARIZED. HE DOES NOT EXPLAIN THINGS PROPERLY. WORST PROFESSOR EVER. LECTURES WERE MOSTLY GUEST LECTURES. DO NOT TAKE!!!!
I can appreciate a course that's graded by multiple things. Not the best not the worst prof. Unsure of what's on the exam. Lectures are interesting

Possibly the worst prof I've ever had. Half the lectures are guest lectures, other half get canceled. Answers simple yes or no question with "I've already answered that". Don't even know what's on the final due to unclear info, lectures are hard to follow and unsuitable for 200 level course. Take with different prof if you can.

Not my favorite prof but he's not as bad as some are saying. This sem was very uncertain and just like us he was still learning to adapt and tried his best. The course was lecture heavy and his grading was VERY tough at times (partmarks if u didn't have specific words) but overall an interesting course and put in the work and you'll get a good mark

Ralph is an extremely inconsiderate prof. Even when deadlines were miscommunicated due to errors on the TA's behalf, Ralph still penalized students 20%. His lectures and instructions are also unclear. His actions are unacceptable in general, but especially during a pandemic where student stress is heightened.

Applied a 20% late penalty when the due date was mixed up on their end. IDK if he is lazy but I had more guest lectures in this course than I have had in SFU. He is not very helpful either, when a student asked for clarification, he basically told him to read it til he gets it. Not even sure whats on the final since he taught only half the course.

This class is a joke. The guest lectures were confusing and so were the expectations of the prof. He is so INCONSIDERATE and doesnt even answer questions. Legit the worst class ever and worst prof ever. Theres are more guest lectures than actual lectures and ur expected to understand them. Plus the TA MESSED UP THE DUE DATE and we still got -20%

Avoid at all costs, worst prof ever. he doesn't know how to teach and his slides are useless. whole course are guest lecturers so you don't even know what you're being tested on and he refuses to answer any questions, rlly messy. He is unconsiderate on deadlines and very strict on marking. confusing marking scheme

There are more guest lectures in the course than prof lectures, so prepare yourself to learn from a new prof each week. Most of the material presented by guest is not 200 level appropriate, very difficult. Very passive aggressive and inconsiderate prof to ones situation and TA's are not much better. Worse course I have taken at SFU.

The class is not really that hard but Ralph is seriously a bad prof. Super lazy and frustratingly rigid in terms of instruction and marking. As another review mentioned, TA mixed up the due date but Ralph still applied the 20% late penalty. The assignments were also mostly not on the course material you have to look and find the answers yourself.

Worst PROF EVER. DO NOT TAKE HIM AS A PROFESSOR. No clear instructions on assignments as mentioned in the other rating and even when you ask they will not clarify. The TAs are even worse with inconsistent marking and messing up due date. Prof is very inconsiderate as TA had messed up the due date but 20% late penalty was still applied. DONT TAKE
Cathy is the nicest and most helpful TA ever! She defiantly cares about her students and goes out of her way to help them!

I really enjoyed this class. I felt that it was a good mix of readings, videos, projects, and lectures. I am not very strong in terms of hard sciences so I had to get a tutor for some of the concepts but I ended up doing well. Bob is really sweet and awkward and tells the best dad jokes! Make sure you get a good TA, it'll make all the difference.
He was clear, he made the material interesting.  Great sense of humour!
I really hate the guest lecturers. Your TA will be your marker. So choose TA wisely. B/c some TA could give you low partipation mark even though you attend all tutorials.

212 is not Mr. Hogg's area of expertise. He only taught a handful of lectures; the rest were guest speakers. He's kinda funny which makes class bearable but I'd avoid him as prof. WIth all the different speakers, the notes were not uniform. Makes studying for midterm and final very difficult cuz we cover so much material and way in depth.
He doesn't deserve to get paid. He doesn't do any teaching except for one or two lectures. Exams are long. Know your stuff.

So boring! He's really not a good prof at all...he hardly even taught us. We had so many guest lecturers, which then made studying for the exams kind of difficult, as there was no uniformity to the notes. The TA's were also pretty useless...all we did in tutorials were our presentations, they never reviewed much of the actual course material.

Dr. Hogg's pretty lazy. Out of all the classes, he only lectured a handful. The majority of the time we had guest lecturers. He doesn't really know too much about anything other than HIV, which is his expertise. So when asked questions about other topics, his answer is often "I'm not sure."
His class is a bit boring, but he'll throw in a few jokes here and there to make it a bit interesting.  Class was a waste of time. Exams were fair, and pretty easy with giving out part marks.

Bob is a nice guy, good researcher, but a lousy teacher!  He does not know anything about infectious disease as that is not his specialty.  Feedback on his assignments is non-existant.  Only saving grace of this course are the excellent TAs.
Not quite his area of study -- but he held his own throughout the course. Showed effort in keeping the class entertain while still learning. Generally improving as an undergrad prof.

This is a really laid back professor. Personally, I don't mind him, he's a really nice guy and very approachable. Very responsive to student concerns. I'll be taking another course with him in the summer =)

Awful Prof! Seems to think the class is a joke, always starts late (up to 15 minutes late for a fifty minute lecture). Doesn't know the answer to questions he is asked. Sometimes doesn't even know the answer to questions he asks. I Do not recommend him!
An easy class, with easy exams, and a relaxed grading scheme. Easy GPA booster if you put a little effort into it. Lectures do have too much information in them, but it's not a big deal.
his lectures are very dry and he includes too much information and details which are not necessary. wording on the exam is unclear and is misinterpreted by everyone, even TA's.

I will NEVER take another class with him again! He's not a mean person or anything, but he's just very dry. I could hardly stay awake in classes and most of the time when he lectured I was playing games on my laptop or DS =S
No Comments
